sentence.Network_en: English has hurt me a thousand times, but I still regard it as my first love.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English thūsend, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch duizend and German Tausend

entry.def: A thousand or one thousand is the number 1,000.

example.ex: Visitors can expect to pay about a thousand pounds a day.
example.tran: 游客每天大概要支付 1,000 英镑。

entry.def: If you refer to thousands of things or people, you are emphasizing that there are very many of them.

example.ex: Thousands of refugees are packed into overcrowded towns and villages...
example.tran: 成千上万的难民涌入拥挤不堪的城镇和村庄。

example.ex: I must have driven past that place thousands of times.
example.tran: 我得有上千次开车经过那里。

means.word_mean: 1. the cardinal number that is the product of 10 and 100
1. denoting a quantity consisting of 1,000 items or units

Sentence.sentence: Fifty years ago, they were the latest thing in educational reform: big, modern, suburban high schools with students counted in the thousands.

And most noticeable of all, there is the phenomenon of large urban and suburban high schools that have split up into smaller units of a few hundred, generally housed in the same grounds that once boasted thousands of students all marching to the same band.
""We would have probably gone ahead with this, maybe just getting a thousand iPhones and giving them out," Mr. Yu said. Yu said.
Traditional vocational training in public high schools is gradually declining, stranding thousands of young people who seek training for a craft without going to college.

As a young man, he began walking over tens of thousands of miles during his lifetime, through the south to Florida, the west to California and north to Alaska, where readers are taken a long and particularly hair-raising adventure on a large mass of floating ice

sentences.en: He has collected more than a thousand stamps.
sentences.cn: 他已收集了一千多张邮票。

sentences.en: There are thousands of people on the square.
sentences.cn: 广场上有成千上万的人。

means.word_mean: 成千的;许许多多的,无数的

sentences.en: I’ve warned him a thousand times.
